page.title: 02WILDLIFE AROUND BRILL.
page.content: In this area there are lots of different flowers both wild and cultivated.They include ragged robin, herb robert,buttercups,daisies,lady's smock,bluebells,primroses,dog violet, sweet violet,hedge mustard,butterfly orchis and many others.Some are quite rare such as meadow saxifrage.The many trees include beech,oak sycamore,lime, ewe,elm,ash,horse chestnut,holly and field maple.The birds include gold crest,thrush,blackbird,cuckoo,wren and owl.In this area there are animals such as the fox,rabbit,deer,badger,weasle and grass snake.In this area trees have been sprayed by farmers,fields ploughed up and animal homes destroyed.The forestry commission and farmers look after the forests and woods.The Parish Council and the Brill Society check the footpaths monthly.
